metadata.synopsis: Toobin asks for the player's help to save the Gondian families and free them from serving the Banites.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -318; 6; -163kill the baneites.the dialog will automaticall start at the end of combat.

9.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
9.context: NodeContext: Narn'guth kree'shav da'lor. (naan-guff kree'shuv dah-lore) 'you don't belong here'

105.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
105.text: Your nervous gait betrays your presence, stranger. You don't belong here. Who are you?

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I've come to free you - I already dealt with some of the Banites.

93.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
93.text: Your presence imperils us all. If any of us attempts to escape, our kin will die.

72.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
72.text: The overseers - they have a contraption. When triggered, it will kill everyone who wears a collar.
72.context: NodeContext: gesturing at his own neck

88.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
88.text: You underestimate the enemy. The overseers, they are glix'bran rak'tharr.

17.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
17.text: The collars are not only equipped with explosives, there is also a mechanism that alerts the overseers if they're removed.
17.context: NodeContext: shaking head, feeling lost, frustrated

40.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
40.text: One of us may be able to save themselves, but it would be at the expense of everyone else. We can't risk it.
40.context: NodeContext: shaking head, feeling lost, frustrated

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Rise up in unison - they can't stop you all.

46.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
46.text: Even if we did somehow unshackle our collars simultaneously, and overthrow our oppressors, there would be consequences.

36.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
36.text: Our families are held elsewhere. The overseers need only activate those contraptions they hold, and they suffer the consequences of our actions too.

0.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
0.text: We cannot win. We must aid in building these vargh'kron.
0.context: NodeContext: varg-KRON (damnation). feeling lost, hopeless, angry

35.speaker: Player
35.text: There's always a way. Will you fight back if I free your families?
35.context: NodeContext: GOND-cull (by Gond), shocked, surprised, hopeful. Player has offered to help

65.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
65.text: Gond'kul, aye!  Even more  - I'd help you destroy this place.
65.context: NodeContext: GOND-cull (by Gond), shocked, surprised, hopeful. Player has offered to help

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Where are your families being held?
107.context: NodeContext: love in his voice at the mention of his daughter

56.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
56.text: I don't know where they are. But some of the overseers must - you'll have to infiltrate deeper into the Foundry.
56.context: NodeContext: love in his voice at the mention of his daughter

95.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
95.text: Just make sure you don't get caught. If they raise the alarm, they'll trigger the collars.
95.context: NodeContext: love in his voice at the mention of his daughter

28.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
28.text: I will pray for you. My daughter...her name is Obelia.
28.context: NodeContext: love in his voice at the mention of his daughter

83.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
83.text: Gond'ral thra'kazhul nesh. May Gond be with you.
83.context: NodeContext: Gond-rahl FRA-kazz-hool nesh. (may Gond be with you). Knows he's putting immense trust in the player.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The destruction I can handle. I have a runepowder bomb.
14.context: NodeContext: surprised, thought player was an ally but now fears they've been led astray by wulbren

48.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
48.context: NodeContext: surprised, thought player was an ally but now fears they've been led astray by wulbren

97.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
97.text: Look - Wulbren is no friend of the Gondians. He's a piece of frenk'vol. I don't know what poison he put in your mind, but we are good people in a bad place.
97.context: NodeContext: frenk (friend with a 'k' instead of a 'd') VOL (shit). Determined to show player that wulbren is bad news (wulrebn really is)

96.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
96.text: Help us and I promise we'll help you. You won't need something as drastic as runepowder to bring this place down. I know a way.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: All right, I'll help. Where are your families?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Sorry, but I need to stop the Steel Watch now.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: How do you intend to help me?

15.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
15.text: I created the Neurocitor that controls the Steel Watch, and I made sure I had a means to disable it if I ever had the freedom to do so.

38.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
38.text: Get me close enough to the central mechanism, and I can shut down the whole foundry. But first, our families must be safe.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: The Steel Watchers are tools of oppression - building them makes you complicit with the oppressors.

33.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
33.text: Don't you think I know that? We're no cowards. We talked about revolting. We know what these Watchers are for.

70.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
70.text: But my daughter is among those they took away. I've no choice. And neither do the others.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: It's selfish to value your families more than an entire city.

39.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
39.text: Maybe. But it would be unnatural to feel otherwise.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I need to destroy the Steel Watch. Are you going to help me or not?

64.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
64.text: I know this place better than anyone - better than the Gondians even. I could help you destroy it, if I knew our families were safe.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: All right, I'll help. Where are your families?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I have a runepowder bomb, and I intend to destroy this facility with it, no matter the cost.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It's worth the risk - worst case scenario, you die fighting.

84.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
84.text: If it were only our lives on the line, we'd have rebelled long ago.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: If everyone who wears a collar is helping to build the Steel Watch, killing you all may be a good thing.

12.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
12.text: A grim solution, but one that I may agree with if your understanding of the situation were correct.

32.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
32.text: Unfortunately, we are not the only ones threatened by the collars, or we would have laid down our tools, and rebelled against our oppressors already.

29.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
29.text: Before any of them can press a button in the palm of their hands? You may be quick, but nobody is that quick.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - I'm here to take down the Steel Watch.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Who I am doesn't matter - I'm here to destroy the Foundry.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: If I tell you, won't you go running to the guards?

124.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
124.text: To the tyrants who collared me like a dog and took my daughter? No - I think not.

6.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
6.text: But I do have to inform them. Your very presence here imperils us all.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm here for entertainment - and it's been quite the show so far.

117.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
117.text: If you knew the truth, you would not mock us so.

22.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
22.text: Tharr'dakz. Fargh'nul kreth'nar da'droth. My daughter. Sweet Obelia, what have they done to you?
22.context: NodeContext: Far-DACKS. Farg-NULL kreff-narr DAH-droff.   (Those aresholes. They killed my family)

112.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
112.text: The Banites. They collared us like dogs, locked our families away - promised us freedom if we followed their every command.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Take a deep breath - I'm here to help.

92.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
92.text: It's too late. The Banites collared us like dogs, locked our families away - promised us freedom if we followed their every command.

60.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
60.text: But it was a lie. They used a Motivator, probably laughed as collars activated - burning my friends, my family, from the inside out.

81.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
81.text: All except me. Gond must have intervened - but why save me? Why is my life worth more than my daughter's?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Perhaps the god of invention has a plan for you?

118.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
118.text: You're right - Gond saved me for a reason.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I don't think a 'god' saved you. Maybe it just malfunctioned?

23.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
23.text: Believe me or don't - I care not. But Gond kept me alive for a reason.

108.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
108.text: If I cannot be my fellow Gondians' saviour - then I shall be their avenger.

18.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
18.text: The Steel Watch needs to be destroyed, and the Foundry along with it.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I have a runepowder bomb. I just need a target.

25.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
25.text: Runepowder? Gond's hammer, where did you find such a thing?

114.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
114.text: Follow me to the neurocitor. I will show you how to overload it, and to shut down the Steel Watch forever.

74.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
74.text: My fellow Gondians are likely already dead. Cut down any Banites you see - they've earned their fate.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: This is nothing to do with me.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I'm here to end the Steel Watch - and that means any Gondians, too.

51.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
51.text: The Steel Watch must be destroyed, and the Foundry with it.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I'm in - just tell me how.

5.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
5.text: The Foundry was built to withstand the power of a hundred Wild Magic sorcerers.

54.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
54.text: In its depths, however, lies the Neurocitor - the nerve centre of the Steel Watch.

34.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
34.text: Take me to it. I will disable the Steel Watch - and end this perversion of Gondian ideals.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Hold here a moment. I'll be back.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Come. Let's take this place down.

49.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
49.text: Gond, light the path and grant us your wisdom.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Yes! Let's make these bastards suffer.

66.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
66.text: With what I have planned, they will do more than suffer.

98.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
98.text: I don't need freedom. I want vengeance.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I don't have time for this - die already.

27.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
27.text: Have you found them - our families?

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I think they're being held underwater.

91.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
91.text: The Banites must have a way of getting to and from the prison. I suggest you search the docks.

21.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
21.text: Keep searching. We must find them - please.

45.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
45.text: We need to move. The Neurocitor lies in the depths of the Foundry - and I have no doubt more than Banites await us.

68.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
68.text: Leave, I beg of you. A Motivator is all that stands between my daughter and an agonising death.

71.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
71.text: There is little time - take me to the Neurocitor.

79.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
79.text: You've tormented me enough - leave me.

82.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
82.text: I warned you - I warned you of the consequences, yet you had to interfere!

101.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
101.text: My daughter is dead, they're all dead - because of you!

104.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
104.text: I thought you were the cure - our salvation. I had hope.

75.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
75.text: The Overseers must have used a Motivator. Bastards probably laughed as collars activated - burning my friends, my family, from the inside out.
